questions: tell me about your project

details: Initial phone call followed by f2f interview.Formal questions on programming and about the gsm domain knowledge also oops concept.after a week got a call and got the offer.Accepted offer.
questions: Gsm basics.

details: 2 interviews by
questions: design a system of communication on a single medium between remote nodes, so as to guarantee that if any of the nodes needs to transmit an SOS message it will control the medium in the shortest possible time.

details: Initial communication by email, had to fill a lot of forms. Then I was call by a representative to schedule an interview with three technical leaders. The interview were face to face in spanish. After 15 days I got an offer.
questions: There was not a difficult technical question or bussiness related question.

details: Phone Interview by the team member about computer architecture and basic c questionsGot result in a week from the hiring manager, went for an Onsite interview.Onsite Interview was mainly C++ (polymorphism, inheritance, abstract) and Comp architecture(cache, address translations) questions, and few puzzles.2 rounds of non-technical interview, 4 round of technical interview.
questions: what is the most difficult project that you have completed till now?
Did you have any conflict at work?

details: Has been asked for software language competency, just basically one round interview to get the job. Permanent jobs only available to fresh, Graduate Trainee depends on the availability of headcount.Try to impress the interviewer with projects done, methodologies and ideas.
questions: How would you handle conflict?

details: The HR from the company contacted me over email and fixed the date for the telephonic interview. Later once I got selected, there was a site interview tooOnce you get confirmed, HR will come and give you the grade level and salary details
questions: Should expect all difficult technical questionsIn my field SQL, there was a question regarding SCD - Slowly changing dimension

details: I did very well in the phone interview, I was provided an onsite interview. However in the end, I found out that Intel doesn't sponsor H1 visa, and because I didn't have work permit in the US, I can't work for Intel. The phone interview was cordial and pleasant. Most were behavior questions, it's an entry level position, therefore not much technical experience was needed.
questions: Tell me about yourself.
What do you know about the job?

details: Very professional, good questions
questions: Why are you leaving your position
Can you tell me your experience with this system

details: First interview: interviewed by two engineers. Handed me a piece of paper with some C code and asked me to find the bugs in the code. Found stack overflow and heap overflow.Asked several programming questions and also questions on operating systems( interrupts handling in the OS).
questions: Describe what happens in the OS when a device triggers an interrupt.

details: Applied for student position (firmware).Set up an interview on site , first interview consisted of 2 parts:part 1: tell me about yourself , describe a project , etc.part 2: programming questionsafter a day received a phone call , wanted to set a second interview.the second interview is the same as the first.In both interviews there are 2 guys , and you need to code on paper.
questions: fibonacci sequence: recursive and iterative
reverse a byte
reverse a string

OS stuff and networking: threads , create a dead lock, (for example with 2 processes and 2 resources) ,how to avoid a dead lock , describe the OSI modeland explain how it resembles the post office.(i.e. sending a letter and explaininghow the layers resemble this process)

details: No proper communication. Offered very late
questions: Technical

details: Excellent interview, the interviewers had good knowledge of the subject areas. They were polite and to the point, encouraging and even light hearted which helped reduce the tension in the interview
questions: It was a puzzle asked for analytical reasoning test

details: Got a phone call then arrived to the campus and being interviewed by two engineers
questions: Implement bubble sort
Find the largest subsequance in an array

details: In the first interview I was sitting in front of two people, after the usual background question about my CV, both asked me two technical question about the C language (to solve by pencil and paper).Then I had another interview by other two people, they didn't ask me any technical question, rather they asked me "personality" related questions.
questions: What would you do if your manager told you to do something you don't agree with?

details: there are 6 rounds of 1:1 interview. the interviewers were engineers the several teams. each 1:1 interview lasts 30 - 60 minutes. basically focus on technical questions.
questions: design the game Russian Square
code to exchange two integer

details: 1 on 1 interview process. Was quite okay. Look out for all round skills. General DBMS qns, OOPS qns, .NET technologies etc were quizzed on. DBMS qns, OOPS qns, .NET technologies etc were quizzed on. Some SQL queries also.Then an HR round. Be truthful wid answers. Why do u wanna work in Intel? etc...
questions: Some simple puzzles.What are the total number of lines written by you in C/C++? What is the most complicated/valuable program written in C/C++?

details: The interview process is very effectively. The skill test covered the CS and EE knowledge. The CS part is relatively easy and not covered the newest CS skills. The atomosphere is esay and kind. The interviewers are all kind. The skill test lasts for about 2 hour. And they also will discuss the problems in the test.
questions: The questions about EE knowledge.
